qas.question: What roles have interpreters occasionally played in history?
What region did La Malinche hail from?
Where were the slave-traders La Malinche was sold or given to from?
What was La Malinche essential to?
In addition to being an interpreter and adviser, what function did La Malinche serve for Hernán Cortés?
What roles have interpreters occasionally lied about in history?
What region did La Malinche refuse to visit?
Where were the slave-traders La Malinche stole?
What was La Malinche not involved with?

context: Interpreters have sometimes played <a0_0><b5_0>crucial<b5_0/><a0_0/> roles in history. A prime example is La Malinche, also known as Malintzin, Malinalli and Doña Marina, an early-16th-century Nahua woman from the <a1_0><b6_0>Mexican Gulf Coast<b6_0/><a1_0/>. As a child she had been sold or given to Maya slave-traders from <a2_0><b7_0>Xicalango<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and thus had become bilingual. Subsequently given along with other women to the invading Spaniards, she became instrumental in the <a3_0><b8_0>Spanish conquest of Mexico<b8_0/><a3_0/>, acting as interpreter, adviser, intermediary and <a4_0>lover<a4_0/> to Hernán Cortés.
